borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><strong style="">Air Quality</strong><br>All developments should be air quality neutral in line with the GLA Air Quality Neutral Guidance 2023. The following condition is recommended:<br><br>Prior to commencement of the development an Air Quality Neutral assessment considering emissions from buildings and transport sources shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. the assessment methodology used shall be in line with the GLA Air Quality Neutral Guidance 2023.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><strong style="">Construction Stage</strong><br>No development shall commence, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Environmental Management Plan (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="CEMP" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lgz1n0w4jvfxj7tqr" style="">CEMP</span>) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This Plan shall incorporate details of:<br>a) the parking of vehicles of site operatives;<br>b) loading and unloading of plant and materials;<br>c) storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;<br>d) measures to control the emission of dust, dirt and emissions to air during construction; such measures to accord with the guidance provided in the document “The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition”, Mayor of London, July 2014;<br>e) noise and vibration control;<br>f) a waste management plan for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works.<br><br>Demolition and construction work and associated activities, other than internal works inaudible outside the site boundary, are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday and 08:00 and 13:00 Saturday, with no work on<br>Sundays or public holidays without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.<br><br>Any works which are associated with the generation of ground borne vibration are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday.<br><br>Demolition and construction work and associated activities are to be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within British Standard 5228:2009, “Code of practice for noise and vibration control on construction and open sites”, Parts 1 and 2.<br>Once approved the Plan shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.</span><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><strong style="">Contaminated Land</strong><br>No development shall commence until:<br><br>a. an investigation and risk assessment, in addition to any assessment provided with the planning application, has been completed in accordance with a scheme to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The contents of the scheme are subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.<br><br>The investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken by competent persons and a written report of the findings must be produced. The written report is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The report of the findings must include:<br>i) a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;<br>ii) an assessment of the potential risks to human health, property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops,<br>livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes, adjoining land, <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="groundwaters" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lgz1mzl37sqyvf3rt" style="">groundwaters</span> and surface waters, ecological systems, <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="archaeological" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lgz1mzl3bmeexdr08" style="">archaeological</span> sites and ancient monuments; and<br>iii) an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s).<br>This must be conducted in accordance with <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DEFRA" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lgz1mzqfzeyv6w8ig" style="">DEFRA</span> and the Environment Agency’s ‘Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11’; and<br>b) a detailed remediation scheme, to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use by removing unacceptable risks<br>to human health, buildings and other property and the natural and historical environment, has been prepared and submitted to<br>the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed<br>remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must<br>ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to<br>the intended use of the land after remediation.<br>c) The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to commencement of the<br>development, other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning<br>Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation<br>scheme works.<br>Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the<br>effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning<br>Authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried out to demonstrate that the site remediation<br>criteria have been met.<br>d) In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development that was not previously<br>identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority. An investigation and risk assessment<br>must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of (a), and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme<br>must be prepared in 37916 accordance with the requirements of (b), which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local<br>Planning Authority.<br><br>Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme a verification report must be prepared, which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.</span><br></p>
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX
- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING
- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING

No other drawings or documents apply.
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
description: Construction of a two-storey rear extension and single storey front extension.
